Crises have deepened political divisions, and social media has amplified these tensions. In this podcast, I explain our paper examining Facebook posts from recent elections in Brazil, Colombia, Chile, and Peru. I show a trend in this episode: divisive topics ignite strong, often negative reactions, particularly in countries with high levels of political polarization.

::: callout-note
## Episode based on a published research paper:

Divisive Issues, Polarization, and Users’ Reactions on Facebook: Comparing Campaigning in Latin America

By Vicente Fenoll, Isabella Gonçalves, and Márton Bene

[<i class="bi bi-journal-text"></i> Open Access](https://www.cogitatiopress.com/politicsandgovernance/article/view/7957){.btn .btn-outline-secondary .btn-sm target="_blank" rel="noopener"}
